name: man
description: Display the manual page for a Unix command. Returns the full documentation including synopsis, description, options, examples, and related commands. Use after discovering a command name (e.g. via apropos) to learn its exact usage, flags, and behavior. Use for reading documentation, understanding command-line options, or learning how to use an unfamiliar tool. Pair with apropos: first search for commands by keyword, then read the manual for the best match.

input.description: No standard input required. The first argument is the command name such as 'grep', 'curl', or 'ffmpeg'. Optional second argument is a section number like '3 printf' for the C library function.

output.description: The formatted manual page text, including NAME, SYNOPSIS, DESCRIPTION, OPTIONS, EXAMPLES, and SEE ALSO sections.
